content.question: It is known that <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 0, of, the fraction with numerator the sine of, open parenthesis, 2 x, close parenthesis, and denominator 2 x, end fraction, equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 0, of, the fraction with numerator the tangent of, open parenthesis, 2 x, close parenthesis, and denominator 6 x times, the secant of, open parenthesis, 3 x, close parenthesis, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>sec</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>?

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
